poem:
"Under the Shadow of Uncertainty"

Beneath the grey clouds of commerce,
A Eurozone hums its daily song.
Whispers of a record low and hope of life,
Yet grappling with an economic throng.

From the lips of BlackRock, a grim prophecy,
Of bond market revolts, truths hard to bear.
UK election - a storm of promises,
A saga of witless spending, a game of fear.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Eurozone unemployment hits joint record low; UK election could prompt bond turmoil – as it happened 3.59pm GMT Closing post Time for a recap…. Unemployment in the eurozone has fallen back to a record low of 6.4% in November, despite signs that Europe’s economy is struggling. BlackRock has warned there could be a bond market revolt if UK political parties promise much greater spending or unfunded tax cuts in a bid to win this year’s". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
